document.title: Kansas Model Curricular Standards for Library Media and Technology

841C3F56BA3C4953A6CA8C016056BBD5.description: The student uses technology resources for solving problems and making informed decisions.

6145EF789A6B4372B978E5BA88398BEB.description: The student uses technology resources to make informed decisions.

527F2C4EB3F94BE6AFBF0C6C4A56BDBA.description: The student uses technology resources for solving problems.

440A9330B424484AA47679D00FD080E1.description: The student uses technology problem-solving and decision-making tools.

10DFE61F329246B196B5AE0EF5395D71.description: The student evaluates and selects new information resources and technological innovations based on the appropriateness for specific tasks.

92B70A167E2B465785116B4D95D1D8FE.description: The student uses technology tools to process data and report results.

7E95A9243847486C99CC4B152EDAE76B.description: The student uses technology to locate, collect, and evaluate information from a variety of sources.

CFC0EF88EE1D44F19BE017C5E226A052.description: The student uses technology research tools.

356F32ACA81E417BBE79DC8709CA41EE.description: The student uses a variety of media and formats to communicate information and ideas effectively to multiple audiences.

BB55B85E1D924854AA513B39FA4E1836.description: The student uses telecommunications to collaborate, publish, and interact with peers, experts, and other audiences.

4789CFC58AEC4CD39DF9E861F30A68F6.description: The student uses technology communication tools.

53A4803DCD9A4340B286AD656BC65A2B.description: The student uses productivity tools to collaborate in constructing technology-enhanced models, prepare publications, and produce other creative works.

9153B00BED0D41589EA14AB5F9A20979.description: The student uses technology tools to enhance learning, increase productivity, and promote creativity.

50166F1F622D467FB1382CCDC2B28691.description: The student uses technology productivity tools.

95D23FEABC094B678394B7293104884A.description: The student develops positive attitudes toward technology uses that support lifelong learning, collaboration, personal pursuits, and productivity.

E1C07F07F68F4C78BD01A6B2BD78CBE6.description: The student practices responsible use of technology systems, information, and software.

0D4619711EB04888B24103D4C6E8C79B.description: The student understands the ethical, cultural, and societal issues related to technology.

166035B080AC48299F96D2D0C162D34C.description: The student demonstrates knowledge of social, ethical, and human issues.

3DC26E54C8FF4B24AD078929412B616A.description: communicates about technology using developmentally appropriate and accurate terminology.

72E1E03E91844C59A5E46F4D33EE0853.description: uses a variety of media and technology resources for directed and independent learning activities.

76535D79149E44E8940615FDFE47D9A8.description: uses input/output devices to successfully operate technology.

0F5CCA84C0B445228C829063BF8E9B04.description: The student demonstrates a sound understanding of the nature of operation of technology systems.

1CD663E498E94808B18C5258F5D0048E.description: The student understands basic operations and concepts.

ADB65BC45A1348828F472DECC9612E09.description: respects the ideas of others by listening, waiting for one's turn, and using appropriate body language.

476D974F8F51479C93FC2A0350516A88.description: The student respects other's ideas and backgrounds and acknowledges their contributions.

394DBCDE966C4D9C95BB4B0F8EF18598.description: shares information with others (e.g., show and tell).

4B56C63C0AF54519BDB15DB191E48AFB.description: The student shares knowledge and information with others.

CA63319B5FEE459CBDEC51CEF98A9F98.description: The student who contributes positively to the learning community and to society is information literate and participates effectively in groups to pursue and generate information.

31EE3718312B42F6951B72E233DAB99B.description: discusses the role of ownership (e.g., author, illustrator, producer).

C7DA09474BA541F082588BC87F99BC9D.description: The student respects intellectual property rights.

5CE60960F59C4D6BAB3E5B216BCA6F95.description: practices good listening skills, respecting what other students and teachers have to say.

2AF5AD93A34540578233AC7140705E7E.description: The student respects the principles of intellectual freedom.

55CC53330E2643BCBFE25F87AA05751B.description: The student who contributes positively to the learning community and to society is information literate and practices ethical behavior in regard to information and information technology.

D122FEB3D7B3408BBC7DA231E743249C.description: accompanies adult/parent to library to check out materials with assistance.

5F733F0B19C94545A93FD5BE83CCA768.description: The student respects the principle of equitable access to information.

8C7D143C49984BAA8617883D46CCE172.description: The student seeks information from diverse sources, contexts, and disciplines.

0A9F92AF16E04303B1CFA890283B4430.description: The student who contributes positively to the learning community and to society is information literate and recognizes the importance of information to a democratic society.

D3CD5A3CE2BF420793977042BE3E10C9.description: The student devises strategies for revising, improving, and updating self-generating knowledge.

506117DE4DF3406AAA8B067105F17492.description: The student assesses the quality of the process and products of personal information seeking formats.

C2F8352D099540C091DD00AF6FD3BBBF.description: The student who is an independent learner is information literate and strives for excellence in information seeking and knowledge generation.

7D6D33FFC79044AF960D1839E59B3D02.description: interprets a visual and/or aural message in a different format.

A2EDEB81C22D46FAA30FCE8F1F34B9F8.description: The student develops creative products in a variety of formats.

6A86EE9A71D74F95BBE6A900BEBCB402.description: is able to understand and enjoy creative works presented in a variety of formats (e.g., video, film, internet, television, and other creative presentations of information).

4B38FAE7CF024ECDA0513ADA403A277B.description: The student derives meaning from information presented creatively in a variety of formats.

1D7F8233D6D44592B42FFA6D17CBDBB6.description: identifies basic emotional expressions of characters.

D2DFD08E07254568AB67CF4989091EDA.description: participates in and responds to oral language development experiences.

3542A7E4166B48A299F9CAB166907B3E.description: appreciates literature and other creative expressions of information.

1A0AC307E67B460DAB69D506EFED3195.description: The student is a competent and self-motivated reader.

2FF683F3463848589FB64FDB849329C9.description: The student who is an independent learner is information literate and appreciates literature and other creative expressions of information.

A2B87406F0CC4CFA894A5701D55D7E6E.description: The student designs, develops, and evaluates information products and solutions to related personal interests.

6658862F941A4E8EA522465DB537B57C.description: seeks information related to personal interest (e.g., pets, animals, toys, sports, favorite pictures, or authors).

E2EC3FDE069D4E01B3C3CF477148E03B.description: The student seeks information related to various dimensions of personal well being, such as career interest, community involvement, health matters, and recreational pursuits.

D0223E28F04047BEBD2C2CE00949C030.description: The student who is an independent learner is information literate and pursues information related to personal interests.

CBA1D30CFF0F44949D869727C84D28BB.description: is introduced to a variety of formats for sharing information.

DAD3A2DF4EA3495B8AEA9F0BA1BE0017.description: The student produces and communicates information and ideas in appropriate formats.

AAB25031BD7B43A0863739A2C1733DFB.description: is introduced to beginning, basic problem solving.

676463F466CE4244B263D47A753BCF94.description: The student applies information to critical thinking and problem solving.

457027CF453D4F0E8E3ED1C5E62E64BD.description: demonstrates the knowledge and skills to begin to draw conclusions from open ended selections from text, storytelling, and/or oral language.

8D0465EC2B8F4ADC95B3CB295EAD88E7.description: The student integrates new information into one's own knowledge.

EBBFD864FF384C62BC9AFB04117215EC.description: demonstrates the knowledge and skill to do simple organizational tasks.

440F0D617858437EBF3552F0E44C94D2.description: The student organizes information for practical application.

F09A5EC7AD284A1D91ABEDE9FCA5D2B3.description: The student who is information literate uses the information accurately and creatively.

DC194F90B02C4F8EA1233D2A3151E95D.description: is aware of the point of view (e.g., who is telling the story).

5CAEFBD3D508479E98277592BE03FB6A.description: The student distinguishes among fact, point of view, and opinion.

5233E6E5B0FC4BE7AD8861DCAE9559C2.description: with assistance, defines and gives examples of accurate information.

ED1D65D5A9194B739A750D638C64E3EB.description: The student determines accuracy, relevance, and comprehensiveness.

FBEFB5617BEF42F982770EA655917960.description: The student who is information literate evaluates information critically and competently.

6A3DE564D9754AF295816F5BAB62A449.description: recognizes and matches spine label to shelf.

BD20EED98DBA4771B6A7632E5656753A.description: listens to media of various types and lengths to gain information.

42CC24F1A0F244E78ABCFC0FDFAE0FDC.description: locates the library media center with minimal supervision.

4D6833177EC4491C8D89289DC14864FF.description: The student develops and uses successful strategies for locating information.

AFC82874B1804E92B00B0C79D3973227.description: recognizes information appropriate to task (e.g., fiction, non-fiction).

693A7EF32EBD4D6F9CA5A2A58E18FD49.description: The student identifies a variety of potential sources of information.

5CC1E7D3D2D44B65B57399D4432B2D22.description: The student formulates questions based on information needs.

7075121E99C24633B1956F7E9EC87423.description: develops the concept of giving credit to an information source.

02C6A6C53D7D49DC9724145296326D40.description: identifies the concept of classification as it appeals to locating accurate information (e.g., fiction vs. nonfiction subject areas, [dogs, farming]).

803CA48860FC4E7BB3816DD124AD54C2.description: identifies the cover and spine of a book.

55DA7DD9748D49C5801B6FE731F07B7A.description: The student recognizes that accurate and comprehensive information is the basis for intelligent decision-making.

8C7CC9970B974233AFFD7EFA2F84E9AF.description: states the problem or need for information.

F54751C5468341BFA230AA5BFA6DFB13.description: The student recognizes the need for information.

E0C9B18272D441E7A3DAC78FB1314CD6.description: The student who is information literate accesses information efficiently and effectively.
